cheatsheet.title: Getting started with Architexa Sequence Diagrams

intro.description: Welcome to the Sequence Diagram tutorial. It will help you get started using Architexa's Sequence diagram editor. Let's get started!

item.title: Opening the Editor
item.description:
1. In the package explorer, right click on a class that contains some methods.
2. Mouse over the Open In Diagram menu and select Sequence Diagram.
3. Click on the yellow class instance at the top left of the diagram.
4. Click the 'members' button that appears.
5. Select a method from the menu.
-> Notice how the method, represented by the blue figure, is added to the 'lifeline' of the instance.

item.title: Adding Items
item.description:
1. Click the blue method box.
2. Click the arrow that appears on the right side of the method box. (If no arrow appears, this method invokes no other methods, so select another method from the instance's member's button).
3. Select one of the methods in the arrow's menu to add that invocation to the diagram.
-> Notice that the addition of components is animated so that you can follow what is changing in the diagram.

item.title: Exploring the Diagram
item.description:
1. Try adding additional classes, methods, or packages to the diagram to explore by dragging them into the diagram from the package explorer.
2. Select 'Add All' or 'Add Callee Hierarchy' from its right side arrow to display all of the calls it makes.
